title: Data and Code to reproduce our results
text:
Data sources

Global researcher statistics

Total PhD graduates: OECD
Total PhD graduates for China and India: NSF, 2022 and Zwetsloot et al., 2021
Researchers-per-million: UNESCO http://data.uis.unesco.org, “9.5.2 Researchers per million inhabitants”



Publisher and Journal-level data

Total article per year and other journal metrics: Scimago https://www.scimagojr.com/journalrank.php
Impact Factor data: Clarivate
Rejection rates

Frontiers
PLOS, Taylor & Francis: upon request
MDPI: web scrape
Hindawi: web scrape + the wayback machine
Elsevier: web scrape via journal insight website




Article-level data

Turnaround times:

PLOS, Hindawi: extracted directly from downloadable corpus
Wiley: extracted from corpus, obtained upon request
BMC, Frontiers, MDPI, Nature, Springer: web scrape
Taylor & Francis: via CrossRef
Elsevier: ISSNs from Scimago, list of DOIs from CrossRef + web scrape

title: The Strain on Scientific Publishing
text:
This web page hosts the paper “The Strain on Scientific Publishing” by Mark A Hanson, Pablo Gómez Barreiro, Paolo Crosetto and Dan Brockington. It is a repository for the paper and all activity revolving around it – blog posts, news coverage, audio, video, presentations, comments and criticism.

This website will also host, when this will be possible, the data underlying the paper, as well as the R code used to generate our analysis and allowing anyone to reproduce it. This is unfortunately not yet possible for legal reasons (as of October 2023).
